results.name: a(n) = binomial(2n-1,n-1) mod n^2.
comment: For odd primes p, Charles Babbage showed in 1819 that a(p) = 1.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[ Mod[ Binomial[2n - 1, n - 1], n^2], {n, 60}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 14 2004 *)
program: (MAGMA) [Binomial(2*n-1, n-1) mod(n^2): n in [1..65]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 29 2015
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 29 2004
